had tried to break open a golden sarcophagus, hoping to find treasures inside, and some skeletons were also damaged, Zahi Hawass said. A gallery displaying King Tut's treasures, on the other hand, was fully secure and had not been damaged. After the break-in, troops were deployed around the landmark rose stone building formally known as the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities, which has about 120 000 items on display or in storage.
